intro: Gastrolychnis apetala subsp. uralensis, commonly known as the Ural bladder-leaf, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it a notable species in the flora of Central Asia.
